Node.definition: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
= man; ◄ from the land of Uz (עוּץ) ► main character of book of Job

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= marker expressing a speaker's confirmation of the truth of a statement; in some cases the truth of this statement is conceded
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

Node.gloss: to prove to be righteous|to be just|to be in the right|to be innocent
Node.definition: = state or process by which humans and deities are found to conform to an accepted code of behavior
= human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= state in which humans feel emotionally attached to a particular event
= action by which humans initiate a possible argument or conflict with other humans or with a deity by accusing them of wrongdoing or by taking action in a different way
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
= state in which a countable entity is one in number
= pertaining to being a thousand in number or to happening a thousand times
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= state in which humans and deities have physical, political, and/or military strength
= state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= action by which humans act with stubbornness towards others, being unwilling to yield
= causative action by which deities cause rocks to move from one place to another
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= causative action by which forces or deities forcefully remove an object from its place and turn it upside down, which implies destruction
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or objects to shake; ◄ typically as a result of fear, insecurity, shock, excitement, or other emotions

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= vertical structure, ► supporting heaven and/or earth according to Old Testament world view

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= celestial body ► that marks day and night and produces warmth and light for the earth
= process by which the sun appears in the morning to provide light and warmth to the world; ≈ associated with a new period of well being
= path through which a certain entity can be accessed, which can vary from a relatively narrow opening on one side to the entire surrounding space

= celestial body, providing light, and assisting the sun and moon in ruling day and night; ◄ created and controled by the divine; ≈ associated with a high and elevated position and sometimes personified as creatures that can sing and wage war
literally: put a seal on an object; hence: = causative action by which deities keep an object from performing an activity, ◄ as a scroll that cannot be opened because of a seal
literally: to stretch out; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities causes an area to be covered with something with the shape and the flexibility of a large piece of cloth

= the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day
= state of being integrated but physically detached from other, similar objects or events

= action by which someone move their feet with force on a surface or object, usually in a repetitive way ► which causes an effect on the surface or object whereupon it happens; ≈ associated with aggression and control
literally: the back (of an area); hence: = the highest situated parts of a certain location, often representing the entire location
= a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them
= constellation, often identified with the Great Bear or the Big Dipper which is part of the Great Bear
= group of stars forming a recognized pattern, often identified with Orion
= group of bright stars, often identified with the Pleiades, a cluster of bright stars in the constellation of Taurus
literally: room; hence: = a restricted area within a larger unit; ◄ part of the universe
= area located to the south of a point of reference

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= state in which an event has a high intensity
particle linking two events; = relation indicating that event X ends at the time of occurrence or completion of event Y

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= action by which someone makes an effort to obtain information about events
particle linking two events; = relation indicating that event X ends at the time of occurrence or completion of event Y

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
literally: there is no counting (of it); hence: = state in which events cannot be counted or measured because of their frequency or intensity

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= action by which deities or humans move from one location to another

Node.gloss: to consider|to pay heed|to perceive|to realize|to understand|to distinguish
Node.definition: = process by which someone gains knowledge and understanding by observing carefully in order to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= action where by someone takes away an object from somebody else against that person's will

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
literally: to cause (someone else) to turn (from an activity); hence: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or deities to stop being engaged in a certain activity

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
literally: to cause (an event) to turn away (from someone else); hence: = action by which deities cause a condition in which they are personally involved to come to an end
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
= action by which humans or deities provide assistance or support to (other) humans ► in order to make their life, work, task or situation easier

marker pointing to information that substantiates a particular assertion even more conclusively than previous information, which was presented in an immediately preceding utterance as an valid substantiation of that assertion
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
= action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= marker indicating that even if the event in focus is true, another event can take place

Node.gloss: to prove to be righteous|to be just|to be in the right|to be innocent
Node.definition: = state or process by which humans and deities are found to conform to an accepted code of behavior
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

Node.gloss: to beg for mercy|to make supplication
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans try to win a favorable attitude from deities or from other humans ◄ by approaching that deity or person in a very humble way
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
= state in which humans are confident with regard to another person or event, which means that this person is believed to be speaking the truth, or that this event is true
= to make an effort to hear the words spoken by someone else
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

= a strong movement of air, ► causing destruction; ≈ often associated with the appearance and intervention of God|= the fine thread like strands growing from the skin of humans and certain animals; ≈ one single strand can be used as a symbol for a very small distance or quantity, whereas the collective of strands often symbolizes a great quantity
= causative action by which animals, humans and, by extension, deities cause serious physical damage to the body of a human being or animal
= area of physical damage on the body; ◄ caused by accident or aggression; ≈ often used in a figurative sense to refer to difficult circumstances
= action by which someone performs an event without any argument, cause, or reason that could possibly explain or justify it
= process by which humans get the rest needed in order to be able to breathe evenly

= the air that is taken in and expelled through the lungs by humans and animals, which makes them live, and which distinguishes them from inanimate objects like idols; ≈ regarded as coming from God; sometimes God is depicted as a breathing being as well

Node.gloss: to satisfy|to give (people their) fill (of something)
Node.definition: literally: to cause to be satiated (with an event); hence: = causative process by which deities cause humans to become more than fully engaged in a certain process or activity, which can be either good or bad
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force
= state in which humans and deities have physical, political, and/or military strength
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= event where a dispute between two parties is settle by a judge

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= causative action by which someone orders someone else to come to a certain location
= marker indicating that even if the event in focus is true, another event can take place

Node.gloss: to prove to be righteous|to be just|to be in the right|to be innocent
Node.definition: = state or process by which humans and deities are found to conform to an accepted code of behavior
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted

Node.gloss: to declare guilty|to condemn as guilty
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities declare (other) humans guilty before God or humanity, ◄ as a result of (allegedly) having acted in a way that is contrary to the law
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
literally: to make (a person) crooked; hence: = causative action by which deities cause humans to appear to be people without integrity
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
literally: to know; hence: = action by which humans exercise their minds with regards to a certain matter so that they will know what to do

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events

= the state of being alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
= state in which a countable entity is one in number
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= literally: to finish; hence: = causative action by which humans and deities cause (other) humans and objects to completely disappear from existance
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= causative process by which an event has a tremendous impact on someone, ◄ compared to a beating with a whip, ► resulting in suffering and/or loss of life

Node.gloss: to cause to die|to kill|to put to death
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans, animals, or deities cause (other) humans or animals to stop living
literally: a test; hence: = a supernatural act of a deity, ◄ performed by the deity himself or in his name; ► in order to assert his power and greatness
= state in which humans are not held responsible for actions committed in the past or for future commitments
only used in poetry; = action by which humans or deities express their disdain of others with words, sounds and/or gestures

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
literally: hand; hence: = state of being in a position of control and authority over objects or people

Node.gloss: to cover (someone's) face > to make (someone) blind
Node.definition: literally: to cover (someone's) face; hence: = causative action by which deities make it impossible for humans to see certain things
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= particle linking two propositions, by which Y represents the purpose or result of X

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= process by which an event takes place quickly and without delay
= action by which humans move to another place in haste, ► in order to escape from a dangerous situation
literally: to see good; hence: = state in which humans experience well being
= process by which an event runs its course and comes to an end
= boats ◄ made out of papyrus reeds (אֵבֶה) ► can move swift
= tall straight plant, growing in rivers and marshes; ◄ Arundo Donax or Cyperus Papyrus, ► used for making light boats

exact meaning unknown; possibly: = a grouping of large birds of prey with keen eyesight; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten; ≈ associated with large size and great strength, ability to fly great distances at high speed; symbol of protection, metaphor for God, but also symbol for death in battle
= action by which a bird of prey descends quickly through the air, with closed wings ► to capture an animal
= any nutritious substance that people or animals eat or drink ► in order to maintain life and growth
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
literally: to let go of (one's) face; hence: = action by which humans let go of sad expression on their face and try to look cheerful
= process by which a flash of light appears and brightens up the surrounding world; ≈ associated with joy and suddenness
= state in which humans are in a state of fear in the face of imminent danger
= a physical or emotional state of discomfort or anguish
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

Node.gloss: to clear the guilty|to hold not guilty|to let one go unpunished
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities pronounce or consider a person innocent or cleared of wrongdoing and freed from punishment
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= state in which humans are or are considered to be in a state of guilt before God or humans, ◄ as a result of (allegedly) having acted in a way that is contrary to the law
= state in which a condition does not serve any purpose

Node.gloss: to grow weary|to wear oneself out|to labor|to toil
Node.definition: = action by which humans are engaged in laborious activity which requires a lot of energy and ultimately results in exhaustion
= marker indicating that even if the event in focus is true, another event can take place

Node.gloss: to take a bath|to bathe|to wash
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or animals wash (part of) their own body or someone else's body or another object, usually with water, ► in order to remove any dirt; ≈ the resulting cleanness often symbolizes ritual cleanness, innocence, or even holiness

= frozen crystallized water vapor in the form of very white flakes which fall as precipitation from the sky and cover the ground during freezing cold weather; as soon as the temperature rises above freezing, it melts and becomes water; ≈ associated with cold, whiteness, or purity|= a cleansing agent made from the soapwort plant, genus Saponaria
= causative action by which people remove all physical contamination from their hands, either or not with the help of soap; ≈ used metaphorically to denote a change of behavior for the good
= substance, ◄ probably made by mixing the ashes of certain soda plants with olive oil, animal fats, or water; ► used as cleansing agent (AYBC)

literally: palm of the hand, but used in a figurative sense with the focus on the activities that are performed with one's hands; = someone's actions, whether or not performed with one's hands, for which one is personally responsible
= referent pointing to a specific condition or circumstance
= action by which part or all of an object is put into a liquid briefly and, in most cases, soon removed; ► often to absorb some of the liquid and apply it elsewhere

= a long, flowing outer garment reaching to the feet; it was generally a loose fitting cloth that was draped around the body and held in place in the middle by a sash wrapped around the waist or some means of fastening such as pins or buttons; it was worn at all levels of society, including also priests and other religious leaders; it served more purposes than just an outer covering; women sometimes carried bowls or other implements or grain in its folds; for poorer people it also served as a covering when sleeping
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
= state in which humans or objects are jointly involved in an event
= event where a dispute between two parties is settle by a judge
= a relationship linking two or more individuals or groups
= action by which someone with judicial authority settles a dispute between two parties

Node.gloss: to lay (one's) hand > to impose (one's) authority (on someone)
Node.definition: literally: to lay (one's) hand (on someone); hence: = action by which deities impose their authority on humans
literally: to lay (one's) hand on (two parties); hence: = causative action by which humans resolve a conflict between two parties
= state in which a countable entity is two in number
literally: stick, rod; hence: = process of causing systematic suffering to someone else ◄ as if one were beating someone else with a rod
= state of strong fear because of an actual or perceived danger, such as aggression from the enemy, a dangerous animal, or death
= causative process by which a specific event causes someone else to be in deep distress

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.gloss: to be afraid|to fear|to be in awe of|to revere
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience fear
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
